constituent: brush-stroke, one, ceiling, sprout, shoot, shovel
heisigStory: In forming an image for the key word, it is helpful to know that this kanji is used for artistic representations (like a completed painting), and as a counter for the number of brush-strokes in a character (as, for instance, in Indexes II and III at the end of this book). Its elements are: ceiling . . . sprout . . . shovel.
koohiiStory1: You decide one day to paint a kanji on your ceiling. Unfortunately, you don’t have a brush, so, being innovative, you use a sprout. Knowing it could be messy, you search for a drop-cloth, but can’t find one. Instead, you put a shovel down on the floor to catch any drips resulting from the BRUSH-STROKEs.
koohiiStory2: To paint a kanji in your ceiling with only natural materials, you use a sprout as a brush and shovel some dirt to use as paint for your strokes. [modified from johnskb´s].
kunYomi: えが.く、かく.する、かぎ.る、はかりごと、はか.る
readingExamples: 画家 (がか), 図画 (ずが), 映画 (えいが)
words: division, section, compartment, boundary, area, block
